Functions
BLE Utility Functions
utils

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides utility functions for BLE operations across Ambiq Micro devices. It enables configuration, initialization, and management of BLE hardware and protocol features. The utilities support power management, vendor-specific commands, and BLE stack integration for optimal wireless performance and system reliability.

Key Features

  1. Power Management: Efficient BLE power state control.
  2. HCI Support: Handle Host Controller Interface commands.
  3. Vendor Commands: Support for vendor-specific features.
  4. Stack Integration: BLE stack initialization and management.
  5. Error Handling: Robust error detection and recovery.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure BLE hardware
  • Manage power states and sleep modes
  • Process HCI and vendor-specific commands
  • Handle BLE stack integration
  • Support error detection and recovery

Usage

  1. Initialize BLE with am_util_ble_init()
  2. Configure power management settings
  3. Process BLE commands and events
  4. Manage stack integration as needed

Configuration

  • Set up power management parameters
  • Configure HCI interface options
  • Define vendor command behavior
  • Set stack integration options

Functions

uint32_t am_util_ble_set_constant_transmission (void *pHandle, bool enable)
 In DTM mode, set TX to constant trans mode for SRRC/FCC/CE set enable as 'true' to constant trans mode, 'false' back to normal.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_transmitter_control (void *pHandle, uint8_t ui8TxCtrl)
 Manually enable/disable transmitter set ui8TxCtrl as 1 to manually enable transmitter, 0 back to default.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_init_rf_channel (void *pHandle)
 to fix the channel 1 bug in DTM mode
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_BQB_test_init (void *pHandle, bool enable)
 BLE init for BQB test set enable as 'true' to init as BQB test mode, 'false' back to default.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_crystal_trim_set (void *pHandle, uint32_t ui32TrimValue)
 Set the 32M crystal frequency based on the tested values at customer side. Set trim value smaller in case of negative frequency offset ui32TrimValue: default is 0x400.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_hci_reset (void *pHandle)
 Manually enable/disable transmitter to output carrier signal set ui8TxChannel as 0 to 0x27 for each transmit channel, 0xFF back to normal modulate mode.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_trasmitter_test_ex (void *pHandle, uint8_t channel, uint8_t pattern)
 to do directly output modulation signal. change channel ranges from 0 to 0x27, pattern from 0 to 7.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_receiver_test_ex (void *pHandle, uint8_t channel, uint32_t *recvpackets)
 to do directly receiver test. change channel ranges from 0 to 0x27, return received packets in 100ms.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_set_carrier_wave_ex (void *pHandle, uint8_t channel)
 to directly output carrier wave. change channel ranges from 0 to 0x27.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_transmitter_control_ex (void *pHandle, uint8_t ui8TxChannel)
 Manually enable/disable transmitter to output carrier wave signal set ui8TxChannel as 0 to 0x27 for each transmit channel, 0xFF back to normal modulate mode.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_set_constant_transmission_ex (void *pHandle, uint8_t channel)
 to directly output constant modulation signal. change channel from 0 to 0x27.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_read_modex_value (void *pHandle)
 read current modex value from BLEIP
